subject: Education
title: Stereotype Threat: When Identity Undermines Performance
description: A quick win: understand Stereotype Threat: When Identity Undermines Performance.

hook.text: Tell women a math test shows gender differences and their scores drop. Remove that prime, scores equalize.

buildup.text: Claude Steele identified 'stereotype threat'â€”anxiety from risk of confirming a negative group stereotype.

discovery.text: The threat taxes working memory: part of the brain fights the stereotype instead of solving the problem.

twist.text: Simply framing a test as 'a puzzle' instead of 'a measure of ability' eliminates most of the effect.

climax.text: Wise interventionsâ€”reframing tasks, role models, growth-mindset cuesâ€”neutralize stereotype threat.

punchline.text: The test didn't change. The story around it did.

quiz.question: How does stereotype threat impair performance?
options: It taxes working memory with anxiety about confirming a negative stereotype
It causes students to intentionally perform poorly
It only affects students who believe the stereotype is true
